content: Wow crafting a mysterious entrance so here
we go here's the mysterious door I used foam core and remove the paper from one
side then I used thin cardboard for the bottom I cut the door at one and a half
wide by two and a half long and that I just cut a quarter-inch around it out of
the foam core and I cut the door out of the frame so I could just you know the
door could remove I could lift the door up from the base I just used the
ballpoint pen technique you've seen this in my esophagus video as for as well as
some other videos so I'm just hot glue that to the cardboard base and here I
have added the rubble with my construction sand
I'm also you can see it looks a little glossy I've painted over it with the
white glue as what that does is it protects it from the spray paint which I
like to use on the foam so if you give it a nice coat of glue the spray paint
won't melt it so now we'll spray paint it and then start painting it here's my
door it's all spray-painted flat black and I've got my little piece of just
regular sponge here and my three colors gray burnt umber and I have a little bit
of a color called pebble there and I'm gonna sponge this on to the door you can
see all that detail with the pen we did is really coming out so really nice and
the three colors give it a nice color variation like I've done in other videos
so the nice thing about the little sponge there is you can just get the
inside lip there without getting on the black it's not a disaster if you do
because we're gonna paint it anyway so go around the edge make sure you get all
the rubble piles there and I really try to distress this to make it look like an
old door okay now we'll do the back and I just actually just left the paper
on the back of the foam core door here so just stipple that on there nice
effect and now I'm going to use a lighter gray and this would kind of be
like the highlight gray so I'm just going to kind of go around the edge and
that really helps to define the edge I really like doing this go around get
some rubble piles there around the edge of the door and you can step a little
bit in the interior also I just looking good okay now when you step what you can
mess up the design a little bit so I'm going to kind of use some black here and
redefine the design all right I'm use a very thin brush and just kind of follow
those lines that I did this just helps redefine it and make it crisper
graphically and yeah just just follow the lines that you previously drew on
there make the point sharp there around the edge for design figure out the crown
and the skull teeth so yeah just fill all that in there we
go let it dry up now I've got the base and
it's been spray-painted flat black but I like the the darker richer black of the
acrylic paint so I'm going to use a brush and just paint the interior be
careful you don't get the lip because you don't want to ruin the work you did
and there we go a black abyss now I'm going to use a smaller brush again and
my light gray and I'm going to kind of add some rings to the stone here so just
on the very edge and see how let's make those pop it's a really nice technique
easy technique just go around and you can make those stones pop out nice I'm
going to do the same to the door here so I'll just pull out the details of the
door see how that all that detail is really popping out now you can line
cracks to make them more prominent I'm gonna fill in those spike areas to make
them stand out and now start adding to the skull the eyes the teeth and I'm not
trying to color the whole thing and I'm just adding some highlights here with
this brush and see how that's just really giving that some nice stone
dimension but also popping the design out for the eye so there we go nice here
we have our adventures in a ruined area and they're searched around and once
they start searching you could have them find this secret entrance
the mysterious entrance you just put it down on the ground there and they can of
course they're going to probably want to check it out looks interesting you know
you could have a magically trapped or some kind of glyph on it or they'd have
to do some kind of quest to figure out how to open it or whatever or you could
just have allow them to open it just pull that door right off and it leads
into the black abyss which is a great segue into one of your 2.5 D dungeons
and you could paint stairs on there like you did with my perspective pit that
